title: AI startup Pluto launches private market lending platform
description: Investors in alternative assets like private equity, private capital and venture capital often lock their money in for years, but Pluto's founders say its marketplace matches these wealthy investors who need cash with banks and investment firms willing to lend against those illiquid assets.

title: AI company behind dystopian 'Stop Hiring Humans' billboards banned from LinkedIn temporarily
description: SAN FRANCISCO (KRON) -- The San Francisco AI startup behind one of the most dystopian viral marketing campaigns the city has seen of late was kicked off LinkedIn last month. Artisan AI, the startup behind the "Stop Hiring Humans" ads that appear on billboards and bus shelters around SF, was booted from the business and [...]

title: Atletico de Madrid vs Real Madrid: Who will win Spanish Super Cup clash? AI predictions, confirmed line-ups and more
description: Spanish Super Cup: Here is everything you need to know about the AI predictions, live streaming, team news, and confirmed line-ups for the clash between Atletico de Madrid and Real Madrid.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai on AI in Gmail: ‘We launched Gmail on April Fool’s Day in 2004. 20+ years later...’
description: Google is integrating Gemini 3 AI models into Gmail, transforming it into a proactive inbox assistant. New features include AI Overviews to summarize long conversations, automated drafting and proofreading tools, and an AI-powered inbox that prioritizes critical tasks. These updates aim to enhance user efficiency and manage email volume effectively.

title: Snoopreport.com adds AI summary analytics to make public instagram activity easier to read
description: Now Snoopreport is pushing the idea further with AI Summary analytics, a layer meant to make the raw activity easier to interpret. The pitch is simple: less scrolling through lists, more clarity on what the activity suggests.The post Snoopreport.com adds AI summary analytics to make public instagram activity easier to read appeared first on Digital Journal.
